Posts.Content: I am 38 year old female with history of BC in family.. mom deceased from it, maternal aunt and 42 year old sister. I just had an mri and a mri guided biopsy was recommended due to"a clumped focus within a segmental area which shows persistent enhanced curves".. My surgeon said that that description described in my mri report is usually indicitive of dcis and said I should go and check on line about breast mri's.. . Does anyone know a web site where I can find a description of dcis picked up by an mri. Mentally I am setting myself up for a double mastectomy as the risk in my family is too great.. I am high risk and I have 3 young children.. 8 months and 20 months and 8 years.. and I cant bear to be in fear every 6 months.. Thanks and good luck to all
Posts.Title: dcis and mri

Posts.Content: Lauri.. thanks so much for the website...It is informative and I added it to my favorites..A year ago I was adding baby furniture to my favorites.. How ironic.. Anyway.. good luck and thanks again..
Posts.Title: dcis and mri

Posts.Content: I am looking into that procedure now and i live in LI NY.. The problem that i have is that i had 3 c sections and the vessel that he needs for blood supply might have been cut.. Thus i could not have the diep.. where do u live?
Posts.Title: DCIS and recurrance

Posts.Content: Jan I wrote to you privately but I just wanted to explain to anyone else reading this that the diep does not require muscle to be moved just a good source of blood supply.. There is a vessel that this doc uses that if it is cut by a c section then the diep can not be performed.. He wont know unless he goes in I am meeting with him next week to find out my options.. Erica
Posts.Title: DCIS and recurrance
